intro: Clusia caryophylloides, commonly known as the waxleaf clusia, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that are often variegated with yellow or white margins. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in terminal panicles. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often used as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage. Clusia caryophylloides is also known for its ability to tolerate shade and poor soil conditions.
